integrations_researched.name: @mui/x-charts
integrations_researched.purpose: Charting library for line, bar, and pie charts

api_patterns.initialization: Direct component usage - no initialization required

gotchas: ESM/CommonJS conflicts: Cannot be used directly with Jest without transformIgnorePatterns configuration
Performance issues with large datasets (>6000 data points) - may cause freezing
TypeScript: Must import specific prop types for theme augmentation
Line charts may not render on initial page load in some cases (render on hover)
For CommonJS environments, may need @mui/x-charts-vendor for d3 libraries
ChartContainer + ChartsTooltip requires matching axis properties with series data
recommendations: Use self-contained components (LineChart, BarChart, PieChart) for simplicity
For complex visualizations combining chart types, use composable components
Limit dataset size or implement pagination/virtualization for large data
Test rendering behavior on page load during development

integrations_researched.name: @mui/x-date-pickers
integrations_researched.purpose: Date range picker for filtering dashboard data

key_functions: onChange handler for date range changes

peer_dependencies: dayjs or date-fns or luxon or moment (date adapter)

gotchas: DateRangePicker requires @mui/x-date-pickers-pro (commercial license)
Community version only includes single date pickers, not range pickers
Must wrap in LocalizationProvider with appropriate date adapter
dayjs is already installed in project (version ^1.11.10)
For date range picking without Pro license, may need to use two separate DatePicker components
recommendations: Check if Pro license is available - if not, consider two separate DatePicker components
Use DesktopDateRangePicker for better UX on desktop
Implement controlled component pattern for state management
Leverage existing dayjs installation for date manipulation

integrations_researched.name: dayjs
gotchas: Immutable - all operations return new instance
Plugins must be explicitly imported and extended
Lightweight but requires plugins for advanced features
recommendations: Use with AdapterDayjs for MUI date pickers
Already integrated - no additional setup needed

integrations_researched.name: jsPDF
integrations_researched.purpose: PDF generation for Export PDF functionality

key_functions: doc.addImage(imageData, format, x, y, width, height) - add image
doc.html(element, options) - render HTML to PDF

gotchas: When paired with html2canvas, text becomes image (not searchable/selectable)
html2canvas ignores external stylesheets - inline styles work better
Charts and complex layouts may have rendering inconsistencies
Output quality depends on screen resolution - may be blurry on high-DPI screens
Large dashboards may result in large PDF file sizes
Some CSS properties not supported by html2canvas
recommendations: Use html2canvas to capture dashboard as image, then add to jsPDF
Consider setting scale option in html2canvas for better quality
For crisp text/vector output, consider server-side PDF generation
Test PDF export with different chart types and data volumes
Alternative: Use doc.html() for better text rendering if supported

integrations_researched.name: html2canvas
integrations_researched.purpose: Capture DOM elements as canvas for PDF export
gotchas: Converts to pixel-based image - loses vector quality
External images may fail due to CORS - set useCORS: true
Some CSS properties not fully supported
SVG charts may not render perfectly
Performance can be slow with large/complex DOMs
recommendations: Use scale: 2 or higher for better quality
Set useCORS: true if dashboard includes external images
Test with actual chart components before implementation
Consider showing loading state during capture

integrations_researched.name: react-papaparse
integrations_researched.purpose: CSV export functionality for dashboard data

key_functions: jsonToCSV(data, config) - convert JSON to CSV string
CSVReader component for reading CSV files

gotchas: Data must be in array of objects format for jsonToCSV
Complex nested objects may need flattening
Date objects should be formatted before export
Large datasets may cause browser memory issues
recommendations: Use CSVDownloader component for simple button-based export
Format dates using dayjs before passing to CSV exporter
For large datasets, consider implementing pagination or chunking
Alternative: react-csv library is simpler but less feature-rich

unverified_claims.claim: MUI X DateRangePicker available in community edition
unverified_claims.reason: DateRangePicker requires @mui/x-date-pickers-pro (commercial license). Community edition only has single DatePicker
unverified_claims.mitigation: Use two separate DatePicker components for start/end dates, or obtain Pro license

recommendations: Install @mui/x-charts for charting functionality (line, bar, donut charts)
Leverage existing @mui/x-date-pickers for date selection (may need two separate pickers instead of range picker)
Install jspdf and html2canvas for PDF export capability
Install react-papaparse for CSV export functionality
Consider MUI Pro license if budget allows for enhanced DateRangePicker and advanced features
Implement responsive design using MUI breakpoints to match existing patterns
Use existing dayjs for all date formatting and manipulation
Test chart performance with realistic data volumes before production
Implement loading states for PDF/CSV export operations
Follow existing MUI theme and styling patterns in the codebase

implementation_notes.design_reference: 11-analytics.png shows 4 KPI cards, line chart, grouped bar chart, and donut chart
required_features: Line chart with shaded area (Project Progress Over Time)
Grouped bar chart (Budget Comparison - Planned vs Actual)
Filters panel (Region, Project Type, Supervisor, Status)
component_reuse: Use existing MUI Card components for KPI cards
Use existing MUI Select/Autocomplete for filters
Use existing button styles for export buttons
Match existing color scheme and theme
